attributes.comment:
I am very disgusted at the proposed increase for the filing fees for the I-600A, I-600
and biometric services that go with that. I would think that if you are going to
increase fees that you would at least be increasing services and time frames for
our paper work to get filed! Adopting is an extremely expensive and emotional
journey for families willing to take on this challenge.
With the proposed increases this is what it will look like for us:
Here is what it costs to file with USCIS for a couple just to adopt:


What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:


I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That?s an increase of $975 or over 140%! That?s how much more USCIS will
make on just us, adopting parents, with no increase in services.

And that?s not even taking into consideration the fact that applying for our
children?s Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from $215 to $460, a
difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Sometimes, we don?t even get the
certificates for a year after filing!

This is absurd!

I hope you see the real challenge that Adoptive parents already face and the
expenses that go with it. We are adopting from Guatemala and our final amount
we will be paying is going to be around $36,500!
So for the increase of fees WITHOUT and increase in timelines or services would
be completely uncalled for and unfair to all of us American Citizens that choose to
bring an orphan that needs and deserves a family into our family here in the United
States - Home of the Free and Land of the Brave!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Parent, Amanda Anderson
